In much the same way, what goes on inside of us is like the roots of a tree.

data.quote: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of Beauty.

data.quote: Although beauty may be in the eye of the beholder, the feeling of being beautiful exists solely in the mind of the beheld.
data.author: Martha Beck

data.quote: Beauty is in the eye of the beer holder.
data.author: Kinky Friedman

data.quote: It seems to me that the natural world is the greatest source of excitement the greatest source of visual beauty the greatest source of intellectual interest. It is the greatest source of so much in life that makes life worth living.
data.author: David Attenborough

data.quote: Flowers... are a proud assertion that a ray of beauty outvalues all the utilities of the world.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Where there is righteousness in the heart, there is beauty in the character. When there is beauty in the character, there is harmony in the home. When there is harmony in the home, there is order in the nation. When there is order in the nation, there is peace in the world.
data.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

data.quote: No spring nor summer beauty hath such grace as I have seen in one autumnal face.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: Beauty is being comfortable and confident in your own skin.
data.author: Iman

data.quote: A woman whose smile is open and whose expression is glad has a kind of beauty no matter what she wears.
data.author: Anne Roiphe

data.quote: Find beauty not only in the thing itself but in the pattern of the shadows, the light and dark which that thing provides.
data.author: Junichiro Tanizaki

data.quote: A rainbow is the product of physics working for your appreciation of beauty.
data.author: Kyle Hill

data.quote: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.
data.author: Khalil Gibran

data.quote: There is no real beauty without some slight imperfection.
data.author: James Salter

data.quote: To me, teamwork is the beauty of our sport, where you have five acting as one. You become selfless.
data.author: Mike Krzyzewski

data.quote: We don't need bigger cars or fancier clothes. We need self-respect, identity, community, love, variety, beauty, challenge and a purpose in living that is greater than material accumulation.
data.author: Donella Meadows

data.quote: When you are balanced and when you listen and attend to the needs of your body, mind, and spirit, your natural beauty comes out.
data.author: Christy Turlington

data.quote: You really don't need to wear any make-up most of the time; keep your eyebrows the way they are, and find your own natural beauty signature.
data.author: Erin Heatherton

data.quote: Cats are the runes of beauty, invincibility, wonder, pride, freedom, coldness, self-sufficiency, and dainty individuality - the qualities of sensitive, enlightened, mentally developed, pagan, cynical, poetic, philosophic, dispassionate, reserved, independent, Nietzschean, unbroken, civilised, master-class men.
data.author: H. P. Lovecraft

data.quote: The beauty is that through disappointment you can gain clarity, and with clarity comes conviction and true originality.
data.author: Conan O'Brien

data.quote: Walk on a rainbow trail; walk on a trail of song, and all about you will be beauty. There is a way out of every dark mist, over a rainbow trail.
data.author: Robert Motherwell

data.quote: Beauty is about perception, not about make-up. I think the beginning of all beauty is knowing and liking oneself. You can't put on make-up, or dress yourself, or do you hair with any sort of fun or joy if you're doing it from a position of correction.
data.author: Kevyn Aucoin

data.quote: There's a difference between beauty and charm. A beautiful woman is one I notice. A charming woman is one who notices me.
data.author: John Erskine

data.quote: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: A woman of the world is anxious to exhibit her form and shape, whether walking, standing, sitting, or sleeping. Even when represented as a picture, she desires to captivate with the charms of her beauty and, thus, to rob men of their steadfast heart.

data.quote: The way a woman carries herself and the way she dresses ought to promote the following types of words: modesty, discretion, wisdom, beauty, elegance and refinement, but not sensuality, luxury, extravagance.

data.quote: We all have our imperfections. But I'm human, and you know, it's important to concentrate on other qualities besides outer beauty.
data.author: Beyonce Knowles

data.quote: Inner beauty should be the most important part of improving one's self.
data.author: Priscilla Presley

data.quote: I think every single imperfection adds to your beauty. I'd rather be imperfect than perfect.

data.quote: There is a beauty and clarity that comes from simplicity that we sometimes do not appreciate in our thirst for intricate solutions.

data.quote: I would never like to endorse a fairness cream. I believe in natural beauty.
data.author: Esha Gupta

data.quote: The fun part of being a girl is that there are little beauty things you can do to make yourself feel special.

data.quote: There are no better cosmetics than a severe temperance and purity, modesty and humility, a gracious temper and calmness of spirit; and there is no true beauty without the signatures of these graces in the very countenance.

data.quote: I believe that children are our future. Teach them well and let them lead the way. Show them all the beauty they possess inside.
data.author: Whitney Houston

data.quote: Let me tell you something - being thought of as a beautiful woman has spared me nothing in life. No heartache, no trouble. Love has been difficult. Beauty is essentially meaningless and it is always transitory.

data.quote: I'm attracted to soccer's capacity for beauty. When well played, the game is a dance with a ball.
data.author: Eduardo Galeano

data.quote: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: A horse is a thing of beauty... none will tire of looking at him as long as he displays himself in his splendor.
data.author: Xenophon

data.quote: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
data.author: Oliver Platt

data.quote: Beauty is not something you can count on. Usually, when people say you are beautiful, it is when there is a harmony between the inside and the outside.
data.author: Emmanuelle Beart

data.quote: Perhaps the mission of an artist is to interpret beauty to people - the beauty within themselves.
data.author: Langston Hughes

data.quote: Beauty and femininity are ageless and can't be contrived, and glamour, although the manufacturers won't like this, cannot be manufactured. Not real glamour; it's based on femininity.

data.quote: When we recognise the virtues, the talent, the beauty of Mother Earth, something is born in us, some kind of connection, love is born.
data.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

data.quote: Beauty is everywhere a welcome guest.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: If the world could remain within a frame like a painting on the wall, I think we'd see the beauty then and stand staring in awe.
data.author: Conor Oberst

data.quote: Growing up, I just wanted to be like everyone else. I didn't value or understand the beauty in being different at the time in my life.

data.quote: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.quote: Beauty is but a flower, which wrinkles will devour.
data.author: Thomas Nashe

data.quote: Beauty is the bait which with delight allures man to enlarge his kind.

data.quote: Rare is the union of beauty and purity.
data.author: Juvenal

data.quote: Beauty is perfect in its imperfections, so you just have to go with the imperfections.
data.author: Diane von Furstenberg

data.quote: If in my youth I had realized that the sustaining splendour of beauty of with which I was in love would one day flood back into my heart, there to ignite a flame that would torture me without end, how gladly would I have put out the light in my eyes.

data.quote: Virtue has a veil, vice a mask.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: I can barely conceive of a type of beauty in which there is no Melancholy.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: Beauty is whatever gives joy.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: A lot of us grow up and we grow out of the literal interpretation that we get when we're children, but we bear the scars all our life. Whether they're scars of beauty or scars of ugliness, it's pretty much in the eye of the beholder.

data.quote: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.
data.author: Christopher Marlowe

data.quote: I appreciate simplicity, true beauty that lasts over time, and a little wit and eclecticism that make life more fun.
data.author: Elliott Erwitt

data.quote: Beauty is as relative as light and dark. Thus, there exists no beautiful woman, none at all, because you are never certain that a still far more beautiful woman will not appear and completely shame the supposed beauty of the first.
data.author: Paul Klee

data.quote: Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them.
data.author: David Hume

data.quote: You can be a pretty face, but if you're not a nice person, it just doesn't work. I'm not traditionally a beauty, but apparently people think I'm all right. If you're a nice person, it definitely helps.

data.quote: The more people explore the world, the more they realize in every country there's a different aesthetic. Beauty really is in the eye of the beholder.
data.author: Helena Christensen

data.quote: Have you not noticed that love is silence? It may be while holding the hand of another, or looking lovingly at a child, or taking in the beauty of an evening. Love has no past or future, and so it is with this extraordinary state of silence.

data.quote: I always find beauty in things that are odd and imperfect - they are much more interesting.
data.author: Marc Jacobs

data.quote: People often say that 'beauty is in the eye of the beholder,' and I say that the most liberating thing about beauty is realizing that you are the beholder. This empowers us to find beauty in places where others have not dared to look, including inside ourselves.

data.quote: The auto industry must acknowledge that a rational transportation policy should seek a balance between individual convenience, the efficient use of limited resources, and urban-living values that protect spaciousness, natural beauty, and human-scale mobility.
data.author: Stewart Udall

data.quote: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
data.author: Christian Dior

data.quote: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.quote: The arts, quite simply, nourish the soul. They sustain, comfort, inspire. There is nothing like that exquisite moment when you first discover the beauty of connecting with others in celebration of larger ideals and shared wisdom.

data.author: Donald Knuth

data.quote: Rio is an energetic, vibrant place, full of beauty and nature. But we face the kinds of problems any developing metropolis does - with pollution, traffic congestion, poverty. data.quote: Every decently-made object, from a house to a lamp post to a bridge, spoon or egg cup, is not just a piece of 'stuff' but a physical embodiment of human energy, testimony to the magical ability of our species to take raw materials and turn them into things of use, value and beauty.

data.quote: All the freaky people make the beauty of the world.

data.quote: When we hear the word 'beauty', we inevitably think that beauty belongs in a special elite realm where only the extraordinary dwells. data.quote: Solitude has its own very strange beauty to it.

data.quote: Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.

data.quote: Heat cannot be separated from fire, or beauty from The Eternal.

data.quote: A witty woman is a treasure a witty beauty is a power.

data.author: Daniel Burnham

data.quote: While Pickstown may not be what it once was, it still is framed by the natural beauty of the ancient river, the sweep of the Great Plains, and the long, unbroken shoreline of the lake behind the dam. It gave me a 19th-century childhood in a modern mid-20th-century town, and for that I will always be grateful.

data.quote: The beauty of Maine is such that you can't really see it clearly while you live there. data.quote: I'm not ugly, but my beauty is a total creation.

data.quote: The human mind is capable of excitement without the application of gross and violent stimulants and he must have a very faint perception of its beauty and dignity who does not know this.

data.quote: Beauty arises out of human inspiration.
data.author: Richard Dawkins

data.quote: The beauty of a finely worked object points to the beauty of the craftsmanship. The beauty of the craftsmanship points to the beauty of the name which was the source of the craftsmanship. The beauty of the name of the craftsman's art points to the beauty of the craftsman's attributes manifested in that art.
data.author: Said Nursi

data.quote: Beauty is not all there is of poetry. It must contain the truth. It is not simply an oak, rude and grand, neither is it simply a vine. It is both. Around the oak of truth runs the vine of beauty.

data.quote: Beauty and brains, pleasure and usability - they should go hand in hand.

data.quote: It is still breathtaking to me to watch people bring love, preciousness and kindness to their inner world, allowing the light of God to shine through their eyes so that the beauty of their soul can come forth.

data.quote: Beauty is the first test: there is no permanent place in the world for ugly mathematics.
data.author: G. H. Hardy

data.quote: I don't have any beauty shop memories. I remember the barber shop.
data.author: Jenifer Lewis

data.quote: My definition of love is being full. Complete. It makes everything lighter. Beauty is something you see. Love is something you feel.
data.author: Sharon Tate

data.quote: By its very nature the beautiful is isolated from everything else. From beauty no road leads to reality.
data.author: Hannah Arendt

data.quote: The beauty one can find in art is one of the pitifully few real and lasting products of human endeavor.
data.author: J. Paul Getty

data.quote: What is man's ultimate direction in life? It is to look for love, truth, virtue, and beauty.
data.author: Shinichi Suzuki

data.quote: You're beautiful, like a May fly.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: You can take no credit for beauty at sixteen. But if you are beautiful at sixty, it will be your soul's own doing.
data.author: Marie Stopes

data.quote: I am a thing of beauty.

data.author: Imelda Marcos

data.quote: Really, at the end of the day, the only thing you can control is yourself; the only person you can truly educate is yourself. You have to redefine what beauty is to you so you can't be affected by what people are saying.

data.quote: Beauty is ever to the lonely mind a shadow fleeting; she is never plain. She is a visitor who leaves behind the gift of grief, the souvenir of pain.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: Dear God! how beauty varies in nature and art. In a woman the flesh must be like marble in a statue the marble must be like flesh.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

data.quote: The coniferous forests of the Yosemite Park, and of the Sierra in general, surpass all others of their kind in America, or indeed the world, not only in the size and beauty of the trees, but in the number of species assembled together, and the grandeur of the mountains they are growing on.

data.quote: I love glamour and artificial beauty. I love the idea of artifice and dressing up and makeup and hair.

data.quote: I discovered that the horse is life itself, a metaphor but also an example of life's mystery and unpredictability, of life's generosity and beauty, a worthy object of repeated and ever changing contemplation.
data.author: Jane Smiley

data.quote: When a man becomes a writer, I think he takes on a sacred obligation to produce beauty and enlightenment and comfort at top speed.
data.author: Kurt Vonnegut

data.quote: Beauty and the devil are the same thing.
data.author: Robert Mapplethorpe

data.quote: We Orientals find beauty not only in the thing itself but in the pattern of the shadows, the light and darkness which that thing provides.
data.author: Junichiro Tanizaki

data.quote: But the gravest difficulty, and perhaps the most important, in poetry meant solely for recitation, is the difficulty of achieving verbal beauty, or rather of making verbal beauty tell.
data.author: Lascelles Abercrombie

data.quote: Beauty does not linger; it only visits. Yet beauty's visitation affects us and invites us into its rhythm; it calls us to feel, think and act beautifully in the world: to create and live a life that awakens the Beautiful. A life without delight is only half a life.
data.author: John O'Donohue

data.quote: I've seen the majestic beauty of nature and the overwhelming perfection of it. To me, there's nothing closer to God than that.
data.author: Cote de Pablo

data.quote: The soul preserves beauty.
data.author: Isabelle Adjani

data.quote: A beauty is a woman you notice a charmer is one who notices you.
data.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

data.quote: The beautiful remains so in ugly surroundings.
data.author: Malcolm de Chazal

data.quote: Real beauty knocks you a little bit off kilter.
data.author: David Byrne

data.quote: Beauty in distress is much the most affecting beauty.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: Beauty makes idiots sad and wise men merry.
data.author: George Jean Nathan

data.quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: Faces that have charmed us the most escape us the soonest.
data.author: Walter Scott

data.quote: I heard the old, old, men say 'all that's beautiful drifts away, like the waters.'

data.quote: I have learned that acting is not about beauty.

data.quote: Beauty is grace and confidence. I've learned to accept and appreciate what nature gave me.
data.author: Lindsay Lohan

data.quote: The whole beauty of music is that it goes where your words won't let you.

data.quote: The past itself, as historical change continues to accelerate, has become the most surreal of subjects - making it possible... to see a new beauty in what is vanishing.

data.quote: In Japan, the people preserve their temples for their exquisite beauty, and there are a great many sincere Buddhists; but China is irreligious: a nation of atheists or agnostics, or slaves of impious superstitions. data.quote: I am a great lover of art, in many forms: paintings, objets, textiles. I don't have the talent for painting, but I have a very good sense of colour, a love of visual beauty.

data.quote: I can resist everything except temptation.
